thread.title: Chinese defender to introduce China-UK football project to Xi
thread.title_full: Chinese defender to introduce China-UK football project to Xi

title: Chinese defender to introduce China-UK football project to Xi
text:
President Xi will feel at home at Man City, as he will be accompanied by Chinese footballer Sun Jihai during the club tour. The 38-year-old Sun played for The Citizens from 2002 to 2008, the first Asian player to sign for the club. 
Sun was widely considered one of the best Chinese defenders in the 1990s and early 2000s. Winning 4 domestic league titles from 1996 to 2002, Sun was transferred to Man City in 2002 and voted the best for player for the club in September. In October, Sun became the first Chinese player to score in the Premier League when he headed home the first goal in a 2-nil win over Birmingham City. During his stint with the Sky Blues, Sun played 130 matches and netted 3 goals. So later today, 
Sun will introduce to President Xi a youth training cooperation project involving Chinese football program "Who is the king?" and the Man City club. According to an agreement between the two sides, the television show will send 10 young players for training at Man City. Related Videos
